revised_title: Isomerism in Sulphocyanic Ethers: The Ethyl Series
tldr: The author investigates the isomerism of sulphocyanic ethers, specifically in the ethyl series, and discovers a new compound with properties similar to mustard oil. This compound is formed by the separation of one molecule of ethylamine from diethylsulphocarbamide and has different properties compared to the known sulphocyanic ethyl ether.
